Pirates-Pick--Ben-Jaclin.title: Pirates Pick: Ben Jaclin
Pirates-Pick--Ben-Jaclin.description:
Wearing Pirate green and gold basketball uniforms, five players step onto the court. The crowd cheers in anticipation as the timer on the scoreboard hits zero. The starting five gather into a huddle. Standing at the heart of the huddle is Benjamin Jaclin (‘23).
     Ben is a three-year varsity

Ronaldo-vs-Messi.title: Ronaldo vs Messi
Ronaldo-vs-Messi.description:
Over 43 percent of the world loves soccer and fans were on the edge of their seats during the World Cup held in Qatar.

Cheers-for-the-cheer-team.title: Cheers for the cheer team
Cheers-for-the-cheer-team.description:
For the first time the WW-P Cheer team won Grand Champions at the Colonial Valley Conference (CVC) Cheerleading Competition on Nov. 12.

Pirate-s-Pick.title: Pirate’s Pick
Pirate-s-Pick.description: Driven, confident, devoted, tenacious, dominant are words people think of when they describe number 10 on the Pirate Girl’s Soccer team, Alexis Contes (‘23). The co-captain of High School South’s girl’s soccer team has had an impressive career playing for South. Competing on the varsity team si

New-coaches-this-winter-season.title: New coaches this winter season
New-coaches-this-winter-season.description:
Coach Kumor and Coach Giordano, former basketball coaches at Grover middle school, join South’s coaching lineup
     Days are getting shorter, leaves are falling and temperatures are dropping. For fall athletes, that marks the end of their season, but for winter athletes, it is just the beginning.

New-girls-tennis-coach.title: New girls tennis coach
New-girls-tennis-coach.description:
Vincent Valenzuela (‘90) lost his tennis challenge match 32 years ago at tryouts on South courts. Today, on those same courts, he is coaching the girl’s varsity tennis team.
     Coach Valenzuela was hired as the new head girl’s tennis coach in June 2022 and replaced Coach Carla Crawbuck. He wo

WWP-Ultimate-comes-back-stronger-than-ev.title: WWP Ultimate comes back stronger than ever
WWP-Ultimate-comes-back-stronger-than-ev.description: Ultimate frisbee is a unique, action-packed sport that’s played throughout the country at the high school, college, and club levels. From athletic layout catches to full-field throws, it features some of the most remarkable plays in sports. Although it’s still growing, there has been an ultimate fri

Lacrosse-gains-national-popularity.title: Lacrosse gains national popularity
Lacrosse-gains-national-popularity.description:
Football, basketball, and baseball have long been the staples of American sports. But another lightning fast, physical competitor is slowly captivating much of the country’s youth: lacrosse.
According to a 2018 study by Samford University, the total number of lacrosse players in North America increa

A-banner-season-for-boys--volleyball.title: A banner season for boys’ volleyball
A-banner-season-for-boys--volleyball.description:
When gym teacher David Colon took over as the coach of the varsity boys’ volleyball team this year, he had one message in mind to guide his squad through their season: “Set the standard.”
With a 15-10 record and their first division title since 2018, it’s safe to say the boys did just that. “I am ve

WW-P-United-Softball-debuts.title: WW-P United Softball debuts
WW-P-United-Softball-debuts.description:
For the past 30 years, North and South have had their individual softball programs. This past season however, a new outlook for softball in WW-P brought together players from both of the high schools, which formed what is now known as the WW-P United softball team.
“I’ve known a lot of the girls for

Girls--golf-aces-its-comeback.title: Girls’ golf aces its comeback
Girls--golf-aces-its-comeback.description:
After a series of athletic adjustments due to COVID-19, South’s sports are fi- nally getting back to routine; one team that’s starting this season is the Girls Golf team.
     The South Girls Golf Team is coached by Michelle Walsh and began practic- ing as soon as winter arrived. With practices

Basketball-team-is-back-in-full-force.title: Basketball team is back in full force
Basketball-team-is-back-in-full-force.description:
“Pirates on 3, family on 6,” yells senior captain Josh Raeter. The crowded circle of athletes from the boys’ varsity basketball team roars together.
     As the starters take the court, fist bumping the referees and doing handshakes with their teammates, the Pirate fans cheer on the players.

Cinderella-story-falls-short.title: Cinderella story falls short
Cinderella-story-falls-short.description:
Think back to Feb 13. The sun was setting in New Jersey, and over 2,500 miles away in Inglewood, California, two teams destined for greatness prepared to go head-to-head in Super Bowl 56 at SoFi Stadium.

Fencing-team-leaves-its-impact-on-the-st.title: Fencing team leaves its impact on the strip
Fencing-team-leaves-its-impact-on-the-st.description: The boys’ and girls’ fencing teams made their return to the strip, playing area where they hold matches, after a year-long hiatus due to the COVID pandemic. There was uncertainty about this season due to the turnover of players–last year’s seniors graduated and new players joined. But Pirates showed

Dancing-on-Ice-in-Beijing.title: Dancing on Ice in Beijing
Dancing-on-Ice-in-Beijing.description: The 24th Winter Olympic Games have concluded in Beijing, China. Athletes traveled from around the world to compete against each other, with hopes of bringing home medals for their respective countries. The Olympics kicked off with the traditional opening ceremony on Feb. 3, and the games finished on

Pirate-Pick--Dean-Lourenco-sprints-to-th.description: The runners walk out onto the track. They get into their stances. Only a second or two passes, but feels like years as the breeze tickles their skin. The starting gun fires, and South senior Dean Lourenco flies off the blocks. Seconds later, he crosses the finish line and claims a convincing fi

Flight-to-Qatar-imminent-for-US-Men-s-so.title: Flight to Qatar imminent for US Men’s soccer team?
Flight-to-Qatar-imminent-for-US-Men-s-so.description:
For the first time in over 30 years the USA National Men’s soccer team beat the Mexican National Men’s soccer team three times in one year.
     This is a gratifying turn of events for USA soccer fans. Four years ago, USA failed to qualify for the 2018 World Cup. “When the USA soccer team didn’

Iron-Pirates-back-in-competition.title: Iron Pirates back in competition
Iron-Pirates-back-in-competition.description:
This school year, South gym goers are excited as ever as they had the opportunity to show their progress in the first Iron Pirate competition of the year.
     The biannual Iron Pirate competition is an individual event where participants demonstrate their one repetition maximum in bench press,

Swimming-Into-Action.title: Swimming Into Action
Swimming-Into-Action.description:
The boys’ and girls’ swim teams were back in the water this year to prepare for their long-awaited swim season. Like other winter sports, the swim season was modified last year due to the pandemic.
Last year swim meets were asynchronous. Swimmers competed by sending in times of each swimming e

WW-P-Cheer-Team.title: WW-P Cheer Team
WW-P-Cheer-Team.description:
“U-N-I-T-E-D. United. Let’s Go!” shouted the South and North Cheer Teams as they cheered on the WW-P football team.

These are some of the words the girls on the tennis team used to describe their experience at the Mercer County Tournament (MCT). After six years of consecutive losses at the MCT tournaments, a competition held for high school teams in the Mercer County area, the Girl

Soccer-team-back-on-the-field.title: Soccer team back on the field
Soccer-team-back-on-the-field.description:
“Who are we?” shouts Coach Coburn.
“Pirates!” roar out the huddled circle made up of members of the Boys’ Varsity Soccer team.
“1..2..3.. South!”
As the players rush the pitch, throwing their arms in the air, the crowd cheers and the stands tremble. The boys’ soccer team is back.

Sibana Gonzalez poised to spike the volleyball.
Junior Sibana Gonzalez has been part of the Girls’ Varsity Volleyball team for three years and is just beginning her journey as one of New Jersey’s top players with dreams of playing Division 1 and going professional.

From practices to matches, changes in the 2020-21 sports season modified the way we look at high school sports such as the boys volleyball season.

Basketball-update.title: Basketball update
Basketball-update.description: Ever since the coronavirus pandemic created the need for quarantine, there has been much uncertainty surrounding the 20-21 school sports season. Hucking-through-the-pandemic.title: Hucking through the pandemic
Hucking-through-the-pandemic.description:
“Go Knirates!” shouted the WWP girls Ultimate Frisbee team, adrenaline rushing as they watched the seven players on-field run toward the disc. Remembering those games now, the team often wonders, “What if times were different?” 
The 2018 South Pirates Girls Ultimate Frisbee team convenes for a

National-sports-during-COVID-19.title: National sports during COVID-19
National-sports-during-COVID-19.description: The coronavirus pandemic affected our world and impacted our daily lives in immeasurable ways and athletes are no exception. National sports safety standards have changed in accordance to the Center of Disease Control’s (CDC’s) guidelines. This issue garnered attention on whether or not opening

Fall-sports-dilemma--To-play-or-not-to-p.title: Fall sports dilemma: To play or not to play
Fall-sports-dilemma--To-play-or-not-to-p.description:
According to district officials, The New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association (NJSIAA), the primary governing body concerning kids’ sports, may not be putting students’ health first when it comes to recommending them to “return to play.”

Missing-a-season-will-not-sacrifice-thei.title: Missing a season will not sacrifice their everlasting bond
Missing-a-season-will-not-sacrifice-thei.description:
The lacrosse players crowd together for a team photo, grinning as they proudly hold their lacrosse sticks in front of South’s bleachers. Little did they know that this would be their last photo with the class of 2020.

Boys-Tennis-seniors-undefeated-on-court.title: Boys Tennis seniors undefeated on court

The Boys Tennis team captains senior Sahil Kumtakarand Aryan Chitnis talked about missing their final season.

Skateboarding-in-the-Olympics.title: Skateboarding in the Olympics
Skateboarding-in-the-Olympics.description:
For the first time in Olympic history, skateboarding will be added to the Tokyo 2021 Games. Due to the Coronavirus pandemic, the summer Olympics was postponed to 2021.

Spring-Sports--Girls-Softball.title: Spring Sports: Girls Softball

Boys-Volleyball--Seniors-last-season.title: Boys Volleyball: Seniors last season
Boys-Volleyball--Seniors-last-season.description: “I hope that these boys were able to create memories that will last a lifetime,” said Coach Michael Hussong, a Health and Physical Education teacher, about South’s Boys Volleyball seniors. “And I hope that I was able to provide them the tools to succeed in the next chapter of their lives.”

Senior Isabella McCloskey got into position and stared down at the small golf ball resting on the tee. She leaned forward, took aim, and the sound of a gentle “swoof” echoed through the air as her club contacted the ball, sending it flying across the field.

“Well, it really puts an unforgettable dent in the memories I’ll have from high school,” said senior Seungha Jung, member of the boys varsity baseball team, reflecting on missing the final season of his high school career.

Fitness-during-quarantine.title: Fitness during quarantine
Fitness-during-quarantine.description:
“Working out keeps me sane and clears my head,” said senior Amy Deng. “Because everything is virtual, we’re pretty much staring at technology the whole day which I honestly don’t think is that healthy. I don’t bring my phone when I go running, and it feels really nice,”.

South-Step-Team-steps-its-way-to-success.title: South Step Team steps its way to success
South-Step-Team-steps-its-way-to-success.description:
The spotlights shine on the dancers as they clap, stomp and shout to the rhythm of the music. The South Step Team’s performance took place in the playhouse on Feb. 21 during their Black History Month Showcase.

A-pause-on-March-Madness.title: A pause on March Madness
A-pause-on-March-Madness.description:
After 80 years of March Madness, the NCAA (National Collegiate Athletic Association) canceled the tournament due to the coronavirus pandemic.

The whistle blows and senior Dana Jung dives into the pool, smooth and graceful, the water splashing in her wake. While the water may be cold, Dana’s passion and the hope of first place is the heat that drives her when she races.

The stands shook, the players lined up, the crowd thundered and television viewers cheered throughout the country on Feb. 2 for the 54th National Football League Super Bowl.

Senior-Tegveer-Gill---One-of-the-best-at.title: Senior Tegveer Gill: “One of the best athletes”
Senior-Tegveer-Gill---One-of-the-best-at.description:
Senior Tegveer Gill “is one of the best athletes walking around in our school. That’s how gifted he is,” said Coach Beth Fitzpatrick.

Winter-Guard-in-synchrony.title: Winter Guard in synchrony
Winter-Guard-in-synchrony.description: In perfect synchrony, Winter Guard members throw green and blue flags in the air and catch them flawlessly. Others do the same with wooden rifles or sabres. This is a typical day of practice for these members who are working to improve their technique to prepare for their next competition.

South-steps-up-the-game-with-its-newest-.title: South steps up the game with its newest addition, The Step Team
South-steps-up-the-game-with-its-newest-.description:
For the first time, the Step Team has been approved to become an official club. In previous years, it was an informal student-run activity.

The-Boys-Cross-Country-team-s-run-to-vic.description:
The South Boys Cross-Country (XC) team ran one of the toughest courses this season — the Holmdel course, a 5k course with hills and daunting rocky roads. They placed ninth in the state.

With the momentum of two wins before the Homecoming game, WW-P United, the combined North and South football team, looked forward to their third win in a row. The team had the support of over 1,000 fans as they faced off against the Tigers from Princeton High School.

Serving-up-wins--South-girl-s-tennis-tea.description:
Long pre-season hours, extensive conditioning and hours perfecting serves and volleys have paid off for South’s girls’ tennis team. On Sept. 27, the South girls’ tennis team achieved an undefeated record of 5-0, a record that had not been achieved since before 2011 .

Seasons-Greetings--Winter-sports-takeoff.description:
